alert.note: Alert for Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 06 at 4:21AM MDT until September 07 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 10 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR POOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY RECOVERY TUESDAY NIGHT FOLLOWED BY WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WEDNESDAY... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101). * Winds: Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. Localized ridgetop gusts to 30 mph. * Timing: Tuesday night through Wednesday evening. * Relative Humidities: 20 to 25 percent valleys and 25 to 35 percent mountains. * Temperatures: Upper 80s in the valleys and upper 70s and 80s in the mountains. * Impacts: Poor humidity recovery overnight may cause high elevation fires to burn actively through the night. Gusty winds during the day time along with very dry humidity could cause current fires to spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
